oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Tony Arata - 2017-04-08
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by Tony Arata from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on April 8, 2017. Includes questions from the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tony Arata;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in Music / (02:44) Opening comments and introduction of Tony Arata by Abi Tapia / 05:43) Opening comments by Tony (05:45) Performs Night By Night / (06:06) Tony talks about his arriving in Nashville / (09:19) Here I Am / (12:23) Tony talks about meeting Pat Alger and Trisha Yearwood / (14:32) Performs Sing You Back To Me / (17:36) Tony talks about Suzy Bogguss / (18:40) Performs Love Every Time / (20:55) Tony tells Chet Atkins story / (21:34) Tony talks about how he got to Nashville and first meeting with Garth Brooks / (26:15) Performs The Dance / (29:33) Answers question about lyrics and how his background in journalism inform his lyric writing / 32:39) Answers question and changing and/or adding lyrics for recordings / (35:33) Hardest lesson learned when he moved to Nashville / (36:43) Talks about Pat Alger and performs My Mother's Son / (39:27) Talks about his parents and his wife / (41:08) Performs unidentified song likely titled She's The Difference /

(43:35) Tony talks about his first experience at an open mic night in Nashville and moving to Nashville / (46:11) Performs Hand Full Of Dust / 48:46 Closing comments by Tony Arata / (48:59) Walk-out Music / (51:24) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Arata, Tony; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
